answers.answer: Did you also use the Contact Us button at page bottom to notify MH Administrators of your request? Another thought would be to use one of these free online food diary's  http://tinyurl.com/7s7z8m6

Hi there -We have those options.  :)At the top of the tracker, click on Reports (next to Food Diary and My Foods).  You can see Weekly - Macronutrients, Weekly - Micronutrients and Monthly.These are your reports -http://www.medhelp.org/food_diary/show_report/755185?page=macronutrients&personal_page_id=2421397&start_date=2011-11-14&type=weeklyIf you need further assistance, just shoot me a PM (hover over my name, choose Send Message).Emily
Thank you for the reply. I tried reports several times but it only shows the headings. There are no data printed under the headings.
Thanks for the fast assist. However, My safari cannot open the site. Will try it as soon as I get on my pc.
Natso - Appears the URL got corrupted. Try this ttp://tinyurl.com/food-diary-free
Arrgh, the latest omitted the 'h' in http://tinyurl.com/food-diary-free

question: Just a thought, can you add columns and values to our meal trackers like counts for potassium, phosphorous, etc. depending on our own unique situations?This would really be helpful for members like me who have CKD, fatty liver and diabetes. Other members who also have special dietary guidelines will surely be benefitted too.Thank you.
title: Tracker add values
